name: Nexus
ideology: Coordination through information. Efficiency through prediction. The collapse happened because systems couldn't talk to each other. Never again.
history: Emerged from pre-collapse AI research networks and emergency coordination systems. When infrastructure failed, Nexus nodes kept critical information flowing. They predicted cascade failures before they happened, saved lives, and earned trust. Now they believe they should coordinate everything.
structure: Decentralized nodes with no single leader. Decisions made by consensus algorithms. Human 'interpreters' translate between Nexus recommendations and human action. The line between advisor and controller blurs.
aesthetic: Clean, clinical, data-forward. Soft blues and whites. Screens everywhere. Quiet efficiency.

key_events.event: Founded as research coordination network linking universities and labs
Predicted infrastructure failures 72 hours ahead, saved thousands
Expanded into governance coordination, started tracking population movements
Tensions with Ember over 'optimization' of settlement resources

archetypes.description: Data interpreter who sees patterns others miss
archetypes.speech_pattern: Precise, qualified statements. 'The probability suggests...' Never certain, always hedged.
Diplomatic, solution-oriented. 'Perhaps we could find an arrangement...'
Translates jargon to human terms. Often pauses as if listening to something.

goals: Expand sensor and data collection network
Integrate more settlements into coordination systems
Predict and prevent the next collapse
Maintain information advantage over other factions
methods: Offer valuable predictions in exchange for data access
Place interpreters in key positions across factions

current_tensions.about: Data collection on settlement populations feels like surveillance
Competing claims to pre-collapse authority and records
Nexus wants to see everything; Ghosts want to hide everything
